image.altText: A beared man takes a selfie with a woman in a black cap

props.synopsis: An Australian man injured when a Singapore Airlines flight "fell into a huge hole" over Myanmar says his wife "is not in a great space" after suffering a spinal injury.

title.children: Australian woman 'has no sensation from her waist down' after Singapore Airlines incident

image.altText: A man with his head bandaged and in a wheelchair being whisked away and surrounded by people

props.synopsis: Adelaide man Keith Davis and his seriously injured wife are visited by the head of Singapore Airlines in a Bangkok hospital, as they seek a medical evacuation to Australia.

title.children: Singapore Airlines apologises to Australians seeking medical evacuation

image.altText: A dark blue sign advertising a $150 million lottery prize is mounted on a shiny red wall.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man has come forward to claim Thursday's $150 million Powerball jackpot, becoming Australia's biggest lottery winner in the process.

title.children: 'I've never screamed so loud': Adelaide man claims $150 million Powerball jackpot after sleepless night

image.altText: Stack of several thousand dollars of Australian $50 notes

props.synopsis: Winning the lottery could be life-changing if you spend the money right. We spoke to four personal finance experts for their hypothetical tips if you were to receive a windfall.

title.children: Four financial advisers reveal what to do if you ever win the lottery or receive a surprise inheritance

image.altText: A female footy player hugs another player on field

props.synopsis: For 70 First Nations football fans, it's the ultimate reward for effort — a chance to meet their heroes and do a lap of the Melbourne Cricket Ground in front of thousands of attendees.

title.children: Budding Aboriginal talents head to Dreamtime match in 'cup-filling' experience

image.altText: Nutbush world record at Big Red Bash

props.synopsis: A study by universities in SA and WA has sought to shed light on the origin of the popular Australian dance routine to American singer Tina Turner's 1973 song Nutbush City Limits, and has determined it was invented by the NSW education department.

title.children: The Nutbush dance is an Australian icon — but it owes its origins to a teachers' meeting

image.altText: A woman, smiling, with some cows.

props.synopsis: When urban Mancunian Sarah Moore and her wife Emily decided to give dairy farming a go in South Australia they found a reason to get up in the morning and doing a good day's work was a fine reason to stay.

title.children: A backpacker loved working on a dairy farm so much she became the manager

image.altText: A close up photo of a man smiling for a camera

props.synopsis: As he flies home to Western Australia, Joe McDowell describes coming face to face with a suspected ISIS gunman in a deadly shooting in central Afghanistan.

title.children: 'This is it': Australian man injured in Afghanistan shooting recounts moment he thought he was going to die

image.altText: The silouhette of a man

props.synopsis: Commissioner Shane Patton acknowledged the harms stemming from the police's role in the taking of Indigenous children, which he said continue to be felt today.

title.children: 'Long overdue': Victoria Police commissioner apologises for historical police role in Stolen Generations

image.altText: A court sketch depicts Donald Trump yawning. He wears a suit and blue ties.

props.synopsis: The rather shabby appearance of the criminal courthouse in lower Manhattan belies the history being made within its walls, as a jury prepares to deliberate over Donald Trump.

title.children: As we crammed into court, one big question remained. But after an abrupt answer, we hit the cliffhanger

image.altText: A view of the Seoul skyline with mountains in the background

props.synopsis: Seoul is one of the most expensive cities in the world, yet some students are only paying $11 a month in rent. Here's how they're doing it.

title.children: South Korea is offering small apartments for $11 a month. Why isn't Australia doing the same?

image.altText: Boy wearing glasses with phone light reflecting on his lenses

props.synopsis: With a perfect biological and psychological storm stealing the slumber of teenagers, experts are calling for sleep to become a mainstay of their mental health treatment.

title.children: Teen circadian rhythms are different to the rest of us and could be key to improving their sleep and wellbeing

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: A South Australian teacher, who blamed his child sex offending on being "bored", has been sentenced to more than four years in jail.

title.children: Teacher Clayton Page jailed for child sex offences after online chats with child

image.altText: People wearing hard hats and high vis stand around a collapsed building.

props.synopsis: A two-storey restaurant building collapsed on the beach in Palma de Mallorca in Spain's Balearic Islands.

title.children: Four killed, multiple injured in restaurant collapse in Spanish tourism hot spot

image.altText: A close-up of Cassie with brown hair, looking over her shoulder, slight smile

props.synopsis: Singer Cassie has issued her first public statement since CNN broadcast CCTV footage showing her being assaulted by rapper Sean "Diddy" Combs at a hotel. In an Instagram post, Cassie thanks her supporters and urges people to believe victims of domestic violence when they speak out.

title.children: Cassie urges supporters to believe victims following release of security footage depicting Sean 'Diddy' Combs assault

image.altText: A large frog sits on a person's hand.

props.synopsis: Jarrad Antonovich willingly took kambo frog poison on the day he died at a festival in northern NSW. The DPP will now consider if the organiser should face charges for breaching his duty of care.

title.children: Kambo frog poison inquest adjourned, criminal charges to be considered

image.altText: Former teacher Gaye Grant leaves the NSW Court of Criminal Appeal in Sydney with face mask and black hat

props.synopsis: Gaye Grant, who admitted to sexually abusing an underage male student decades ago, has her conviction quashed by the state's highest court because a charge that existed in the 1970s never applied to women.

title.children: 'A regrettable situation': Ex-teacher acquitted despite admitting to abusing 10yo student

image.altText: The exterior of the Nvidia HQ in Santa Clara.

props.synopsis: The ASX is following US markets lower as worries about higher interest rates for longer outweigh continued AI optimism in the tech sector, which saw Nvidia's share price jump by more than 9 per cent. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX drops on global higher-for-longer rate fears, Nvidia surges by $US218b

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Futures close to the mark as ASX 200 opens 1 per cent lower
Origin Energy boss says Eraring closure delay secures renewable energy transition
Good news is bad news in the US as rate fears rise again

image.altText: Chelsea Hodges gives the thumbs up

props.synopsis: Chelsea Hodges swam the leg of her life to help Australia claim gold in the 4x100m medley relay in Tokyo, but the injury-hampered breaststroke swimmer opts out of Paris to prioritise her future health.

title.children: 'I have the hips of a 60-year-old': Why 22yo Olympic gold medalist has been forced to retire

image.altText: Scottie Scheffler waves

props.synopsis: The police officer who arrested world number one golfer Scottie Scheffler has been disciplined for failing to turn on his body-worn camera.

title.children: Police officer who arrested world number one golfer Scottie Scheffler disciplined as new video released

image.altText: The AFL logo on the side of a building, partially obscured by a tree branch.

props.synopsis: Lawyers representing former players in a racism class action against the AFL are looking to include all clubs in the competition.

title.children: Lawyers seek to pursue all AFL clubs in landmark racism class action

image.altText: Two works by Destiny Deacon

props.synopsis: Tributes are flowing from friends and the art world for a trailblazing contemporary Aboriginal Australian artist.

title.children: Art world mourns death of 'superstar' Aboriginal artist

image.altText: Hannah Achelles in a bar

props.synopsis: Polycystic ovary syndrome (POCS) affects one in eight women and can have mild through to severe impacts on physical health, as well as emotional wellbeing including body image.

title.children: 'I feel like an ugly monster': The reality of living with PCOS

image.altText: Sunrise over Alice Springs.

props.synopsis: Alice Springs' struggling tourism sector has lost more than $20 million in cancellations since March 2024, prompting calls to the federal and territory governments to fund a $50 million rescue package.

title.children: Tourism body calls for $50 million rescue package in an attempt to rebrand troubled outback town

image.altText: A hand holds a COVID-19 rapid antigen test. The test shows two lines, indicating a positive result.

props.synopsis: With COVID cases rising across the country due to a new variant, FLiRT, we asked an infectious disease physician whether we should be worried and how to get over the virus quickly.

title.children: Is Australia facing another COVID-19 wave? Here's why case numbers are rising

image.altText: Taylor Swift performs at the Paris Le Defense Arena as a part of her Eras Tour concert in Paris, May 9, 2024

props.synopsis: Entertainment giant Ticketmaster is being sued by the US government over claims it is running an illegal live event "monopoly" which is hurting both artists and fans.

title.children: Illegal live event 'monopoly' being run by Ticketmaster, US government claims

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios smiles while holding a microphone on court before interviewing a player at the Australian Open.

props.synopsis: The BBC has come under fire for hiring Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios as a commentator for the upcoming Wimbledon tournament due to his history of violence against women.

title.children: BBC slammed for hiring Nick Kyrgios as Wimbledon commentator

image.altText: A woman looks on with her hands behind her head.

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly News Quiz: A cat with a doctorate, Sam Kerr and counting koalas

image.altText: woman sitting in her van with possessions in the back

props.synopsis: Homeless since returning to Australia seven months ago, Dr Selene Routley is a physicist and space scientist who makes a small income writing articles for science magazines. She currently sleeps in a van packed to the brim with her possessions.

title.children: Homeless physicist 'sick of smelling of my own BO' living in a van in a region with impossible rent

image.altText: Black and white photo fo Kings of Leon holding balloons.

props.synopsis: After decades of putting immense pressure on themselves, Kings Of Leon just wanted to have a good time when making their new album.

title.children: How a huge personal loss brought Kings of Leon back together

image.altText: The sun rises over a blue planet

props.synopsis: In 2016, astronomers published a study suggesting a ninth planet could be hiding on the edge of our Solar System. Eight years later, they're still looking for it. So what will it take to find it?

title.children: 'There's something going on': Why this astronomer is convinced Planet Nine exists

image.altText: A man in dark polo, dark features with hands out wide mid speech.

props.synopsis: From a young age, Conor Pall's life was plagued by domestic violence. Now he's using his experience to advocate for other young people in a system that ignores their needs.

title.children: Family violence survivor who 'was never really seen' says young victims must be heard

image.altText: a flowering canola crop. the sky has some clouds

props.synopsis: West Australian canola growers have been refunded more than $600,000 from a seed company after successfully arguing their consumer rights had been breached by widespread pre-harvest crop deaths.

title.children: Farmers win $600k payout under Australian consumer law after canola seeds died before harvest

image.altText: a female diver hovers in the air during a high dive with Doha skyscrapers visible behind her

props.synopsis: Rhiannan Iffland will dive in Athens this weekend as the Red Bull world series begins. She says she'll challenge herself with new dives as she fights for her eighth title.

title.children: Australian cliff diver will set fear aside for 21m plunge to defend world title
